reviews.text: Only good for the taxi drivers. Airport is a few mins by car but no means to get there by public transport, so £10 taxi is your only option. Prime example of badly thought out transport system.

Not a good route to the airport. It looks close on the map but actually would take almost 1 hour to walk from the station to the airport. There is no public transport available between station and airport so required to find a taxi (limited!) in the town.

A convenient station to save you travelling into city centre. The station has a sheltered seating area with a machine for buying and collecting tickets. There's no other facilities other that a chip shop on the station. There's a pub near by and bus stops are a 5 minute walk away along with bank with a bank with a free 24/7 cash machine.

A station with very basic inadequate facilities, inconvenient for airport and most heliport terminals, only good point it exists at all and has quick connections to Aberdeen, as opposed to bus or even taxi journey

In February 2017 - the self service machine unreliable accepting visa debit when l try to purchase tickets. There was a cash option to purchase ticket.
Today rejected my debit card again when trying to retrieve my ticket I bought online so unable to access my pre-paid ticket. Thankfully I got through to scotrail (wonderful customer service). I'm waiting for train now and will follow their advice to show email confirmation. If not accepted I am to pay and they will refund upon my return.
